text: @AnglianWater @mchapmanallen @BurnhamDeepdale @nationaltrust @EnvAgencyAnglia @AndrewDJamieson @WestNorfolkBC @AnglianWater You really feel you are doing all you can?  My 70 year old mother is having to get up at 4am each morning to switch on pump in her cellar, as it continues to flood.  Drains locally are backing up, meaning the already high water table is constantly being topped up.

Stay‚Ä¶
RT @andyscargill: Parkgate Rd took a real hit last week & it will be some time before some of my neighbours can return to their flooded hom‚Ä¶

@AnglianWater @mchapmanallen @BurnhamDeepdale @nationaltrust @EnvAgencyAnglia @AndrewDJamieson @WestNorfolkBC @anglianwater sewage system flooding 2 houses on the farm & car park of shops, polluting a SSSI @nationaltrust harbour, many houses now can't flush toilets or use showers etc, and your reply is that you'll be there as soon as you can. This has been flooding for more than 2 weeks!
@ProfJGrey @BradfordCityAA @TCVtweets @CourtyardDairy @baileyffmuk @EnvAgencyNW @RibbleTrust @Mike_Forty @SandTCUKYorks Is that the one near Feizor? üòã

@emmas_nicol @CleanIlkley There are loads of private septic tanks still discharging directly into watercourses despite new regulations. The @EnvAgency doesn't do anything about those. There is a very long way to go to end this type of pollution.

@holliday_viv @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @enviroexpert @DefraGovUK @guardianeco @EEW_Network @Chilternstreams @HS2ltd @Thames_RvrsTrst @Thames21 The water & sewage company charge the public via our bills for sewage treatment, but they don't always treat it and dump it 'raw' into rivers to profiteer. The same water & sewage companies then abstract it from polluted rivers and charge us again for cleaning it up for drinking.
